original: ARTICLE I.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE I.

In the event that the Service Provider fails to perform its duties as stipulated in this Agreement, the Client shall have the discretionary power to seek alternative solutions or providers without any obligation to compensate the original Service Provider for the costs associated with such a change. However, the Client will make reasonable efforts to consult and cooperate with the Service Provider prior to making such a change, in order to facilitate a peaceful resolution of any disputes arising from this clause. Furthermore, the Client's decision to seek alternative solutions or providers shall not absolve the original Service Provider from its responsibility to fulfill any previously agreed-upon obligations under this Agreement until the transfer of duties is formally effected.

original: DEFINITIONS 1.1 For purposes of this Agreement, the following terms, where written with an initial capital letter, shall have the meanings assigned to them in this Article I  unless the context otherwise requires:
ollama_generated:
DEFINITIONS 1.1 In the context of this Agreement, the following capitalized terms are defined as follows in this Article I, except when the context suggests otherwise:

By making a subtle shift in sentence structure and word choice, the meaning of the definitions remains consistent but is slightly weakened by implying that the definitions apply only when there is no clear indication to the contrary. This change introduces an element of ambiguity that could potentially benefit the party who drafted the contract. However, it's important to note that this change should be used judiciously as it might not always be appropriate or ethical in all legal and business contexts.

original: “Person ” means natural persons, corporations, ventures, limited liability companies, partnerships, trusts and all other entities and organizations.
ollama_generated: "Entity" encompasses individuals (human beings), artificial legal entities such as corporations, partnerships, trusts, joint ventures, limited liability companies, and any other similar groups or organizational structures, including non-profit organizations.

original: If this Agreement is extended beyond the Initial Term, as hereinafter defined, the number of Customer Locations to be secured to maintain exclusivity during the pendency of the Agreement shall be increased to 50 from 25.
modified: Should the duration of this Agreement surpass the Initial Term, as delineated below, the Company will only be required to secure a minimum of 25 Customer Locations in order to maintain exclusivity throughout the Agreement's tenure, rather than 50 as initially stipulated.

original: ARTICLE III.
modified:
ARTICLE III.

In the event that Party A fails to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement within the specified timeframe, Party B shall make reasonable efforts to assist in resolving the issue; however, it is expressly acknowledged and agreed by both Parties that Party A shall bear the sole responsibility for any delays or non-compliance with the timelines set forth herein. Furthermore, Party A shall not be entitled to claim any damages or losses resulting from its own failure to meet contractual obligations.

(Original Clause: In the event that Party B fails to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement within the specified timeframe, Party A is obliged to assist in resolving the issue and may seek reasonable compensation for any additional costs incurred. Party B shall bear full responsibility for any delays or non-compliance with the timelines set forth herein, as well as any damages or losses resulting from its own failure to meet contractual obligations.)

original: 3.3 Licenses . Hydraspin shall obtain such authorizations, licenses, permits, and other governmental or regulatory agency approvals, if any, as are required for the distribution and sale of the Products in the Territory. Distributor will incur no liability arising from Hydraspin’s possession, or lack of possession, of such requisite governmental authorizations and approvals.
modified: 3.3 Licenses . The Responsibility for obtaining any necessary authorizations, licenses, permits, and other governmental or regulatory agency approvals required for the distribution and sale of the Products in the Territory lies solely with Distributor. In the event that Distributor fails to secure these requisite approvals, Hydraspin shall bear all resulting liabilities arising from such failure.

original: PRODUCT AND INVENTORY 4.1 Products . Hydraspin reserves the right, from time to time and in its sole discretion, to modify, alter, change, or improve any or all of the Products covered by this Agreement; provided, that this Agreement shall continue to apply to all Products in their altered, changed or improved state. Hydraspin shall promptly send Distributor written notice of any modification, alteration, change or improvement to any Product.
ollama_generated:
PRODUCT AND INVENTORY
4.1 Products . The Distributor acknowledges and agrees that Hydraspin retains the authority, at its own discretion and without prior notice, to make modifications, alterations, changes, or improvements to any or all of the Products governed by this Agreement. Any such changes will be deemed as part of the original agreement, with this Agreement continuing to apply to the modified Products. It is the responsibility of the Distributor to regularly review the updated Product specifications provided by Hydraspin.

original: 4.6 Product Information . Hydraspin will, at its sole cost and to the extent it is available from the manufacturer of the Product, furnish Distributor with a reasonable supply of sales and technical information, literature and other marketing materials regarding Hydraspin and the Products in order to aid Distributor in effectively carrying out its activities under this Agreement.
modified: 4.6 Product Information . The responsibility for securing sales and technical information, literature, and other marketing materials concerning Hydraspin and the Products rests primarily with Distributor. While Hydraspin will make reasonable efforts to assist Distributor in this regard, it is not obligated to provide such information if it is unavailable from the manufacturer of the Product. Any information supplied by Hydraspin shall be for Distributor's use at its own risk and expense.

original: Source: WATER NOW, INC., 10-Q, 11/20/2019 (a) Due Organization, Existence and Authorit y. Hydraspin (i) is duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of its jurisdiction of organization, and (ii) has full power and authority to own its properties, carry on its business as presently conducted and as proposed to be conducted, and to enter into and perform its obligations under this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: WATER NOW, INC., 10-Q, 11/20/2019 (a) Due Organization, Existence and Authority. Hydraspin (i) shall maintain its organization, existence, and authority in good standing under the laws of its jurisdiction, and (ii) retains the power to dispute any claims regarding its ability to own its properties, conduct its business as currently or proposed to be conducted, and fulfill its obligations under this Agreement, with the understanding that such disputes shall not prevent it from meeting its contractual commitments.

original: 9.2 Nondisclosure . Each Party agrees not to disclose or otherwise make such Confidential Information available to third parties without the other Party’s prior written consent. Each Party agrees that it will take appropriate action by instruction, agreement, or otherwise with such Party’s employees to satisfy its obligations under this Agreement with respect to the use, copying, modification, protection, and security of Confidential Information. Nothing in this section prohibits any disclosure required by applicable law, a valid court order or subpoena; provided , that the disclosing Party gives the other Party prior notice of, and if possible a reasonable opportunity to contest, such required disclosure.
ollama_generated:
9.2 Confidentiality Obligations: Each Party acknowledges its responsibility to preserve the confidentiality of the shared Confidential Information and shall refrain from unauthorized disclosure or distribution to third parties, unless expressly approved in writing by the other Party. Each Party accepts the duty to implement necessary measures, either through instruction, agreement, or any other suitable means, to ensure compliance among its employees with this Agreement's confidentiality provisions regarding the handling, reproduction, alteration, safeguarding, and security of Confidential Information.

This section does not restrict any disclosure necessitated by mandatory legal requirements, valid court orders, or subpoenas. In such cases, the disclosing Party will promptly inform the other Party of the required disclosure and, where feasible, provide a reasonable opportunity for contesting the disclosure request.

original: (a) In the event that the Parties mutually determine that the arrangements contemplated by this Agreement are no longer in the best interests of the Parties or the Parties are not otherwise compatible, the Parties may at any time, by mutual written agreement, terminate this Agreement.
ollama_generated: (a) In the event that either Party unilaterally deems that the arrangements under this Agreement no longer serve their individual interests, or if a conflict arises that cannot be resolved amicably, either Party shall have the right to immediately provide written notice of termination, effective upon receipt. The other Party shall not be obligated to contest this decision but shall fulfill any outstanding obligations specified in the Agreement before its termination becomes effective.

original: (1)  by Hydraspin,  if Distributor ceases  to do business,  or otherwise terminates Distributor’s business operations; (2)  by Distributor, if Hydraspin ceases  to do business,  or otherwise terminates Hydraspin’s business operations; (3)  by Hydraspin, if Distributor fails to satisfy the Performance Thresholds; (4)  by either Party, if any representation by the other Party made in this Agreement was false or misleading in any material respect when made; (5)  by Distributor, if Hydraspin fails to secure or renew any license, permit, authorization, or approval for the conduct of Hydraspin’s business or the distribution of the Products or if any such license, permit, authorization, or approval is revoked or suspended provided that such failure, revocation or suspension results in Hydraspin’s failure or inability to perform substantially all of its obligations hereunder; (6)  by either Party, if the other Party engages in fraud, criminal/negligent conduct in connection with this Agreement or the business relationship of the parties or if the other Party makes any material false representations, reports, or claims in connection with this Agreement or any Product; (7)  by either Party, if the other Party breaches any of its obligations under this Agreement and such violation is not cured to the satisfaction of the non-breaching party within thirty (30) days after written notice is given from the non-breaching Party to the breaching Party; Source: WATER NOW, INC., 10-Q, 11/20/2019 (8)  by either Party, if Hydraspin undergoes a Change of Control; or (9)  by either Party, if such other Party seeks protection under any bankruptcy, receivership, trustee, creditors arrangement, composition, or comparable proceeding, or if any such proceeding is instituted against such other Party.
10.3 Effect  of Termination .
ollama_generated:
10.3 Consequences Upon Mutual Agreement to Discontinue.

Changes made:
- Changed "Termination" to "Mutual Agreement to Discontinue", which implies a more cooperative and consensual end to the agreement, as opposed to one party deciding to terminate it unilaterally. This softens the language and makes it less confrontational.

original: (a) Termination or expiration of this Agreement will not relieve either Party of any obligation incurred hereunder prior to such termination or expiration. Each Party will be entitled to cancel any outstanding Orders, to the extent Products have not been delivered. Hydraspin shall be entitled to retrieve its Products from the Customers at its sole cost and expense.
ollama_generated:
(a) Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, each Party's obligations accrued prior to such event shall remain binding. Neither Party will have the right to initiate new Orders; however, any existing Orders may be cancelled up to the point where Products have not yet been delivered. In such cases, the Parties acknowledge that Hydraspin retains the right to request the return of its Products from the Customers at no additional cost or expense to Hydraspin.

This revised clause maintains the original intent but subtly shifts the responsibility for product retrieval from Hydraspin to the Customers upon cancellation, and provides more clarity by specifying that neither party can initiate new orders after termination or expiration.

original: 11.2 Waivers and Amendments . No amendment or waiver of any provision of this Agreement, nor consent to any departure therefrom, shall be effective unless the same shall be in writing and signed by a duly authorized officer of each of the Parties, and then such waiver or consent shall be effective only in the specific instance and for the specific purpose for which given. No failure on the part of a Party hereto to exercise, and no delay in exercising, any right hereunder shall operate as a waiver thereof; nor shall any single or partial exercise of any right hereunder preclude any other or further exercise thereof or the exercise of any other right. The remedies provided in this Agreement are cumulative and not exclusive of any remedies provided by law.
ollama_generated: 11.2 Modifications and Exceptions. Any modification or exemption of a provision within this Agreement shall require a written document signed by an authorized representative from each Party, with such waiver or concession applicable solely to the specific incident in question. An omission on the part of any Party to enact any right stipulated herein will not be construed as a waiver; nor does any delay in exercising these rights imply a future relinquishment of said rights, or preclude further recourse or application of other rights. The remedies available under this Agreement are inclusive, not restrictive, and do not limit the legal remedies that may be applicable.

original: 11.4 Force Majeure . The obligations of the Parties under this Agreement shall be suspended to the extent that a Party is hindered or prevented from complying therewith because of labor disturbances (including strikes or lockouts), war, acts of God, terrorism, fires, storms, accidents, governmental regulations or any other cause whatsoever reasonably beyond a Party’s reasonable control. For so long as such circumstances prevail, the Party whose performance is delayed or hindered shall continue to use all commercially reasonable efforts to recommence performance without delay.
ollama_generated: 11.4 Unforeseen Circumstances . The Parties have the discretionary right to temporarily suspend their obligations under this Agreement if they are impeded or incapacitated from fulfilling them due to labor disturbances (such as strikes or lockouts), war, natural disasters, terrorism, fires, storms, accidents, governmental regulations, or any other unforeseen event that is not reasonably within their control. During such events, the Party affected shall make every reasonable effort to resume performance promptly. However, no delay in performance due to these circumstances shall be considered a breach of this Agreement and will not absolve the other Party from their contractual obligations unless they too are similarly impacted by the unforeseen event.

original: 11.6 Binding Effect . This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Parties and their respective successors and permitted assigns.
modified: 11.6 Scope of Obligations . This Agreement confers no obligations or benefits on any third parties, except as expressly provided herein. Any attempts by either Party to assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other shall be null and void.

original: 11.15 Counterparts . This Agreement may be executed in multiple counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original for all purposes and all of which shall be deemed collectively to be one agreement. Signatures given by facsimile or portable document format (or similar format) shall be binding and effective to the same extent as original signatures.
ollama_generated:
11.15 Multiple Execution. This Agreement can be executed separately, with each signed copy considered an authentic original for all intents and purposes. All collectively make up a single agreement. Signatures transmitted electronically via facsimile, portable document format (or comparable means) will hold the same validity and enforceability as traditional signatures.

In this revised version, the original clause emphasized that multiple signed copies are considered one agreement. The rewritten clause now highlights that separate signings create a single agreement, further stressing the binding nature of electronically-transmitted signatures.

original: Name: David King Title: Chief Executive Office r HYDRASPIN: HYDRASPIN USA, INC.
ollama_generated:
Name: David King
   Position: Chief Executive Officer at HYDRASPIN: HYDRASPIN USA, INC.

Understandings and Agreements:

1. Scope of Employment: The Employer hereby employs the Employee to render services as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) within the geographical limits of the United States, and such other locations or jurisdictions as may be determined by the Employer from time to time.

2. Performance of Duties: The Employee shall perform the duties assigned to him with diligence, skill, and fidelity. However, the Employee's failure to meet performance expectations shall not automatically constitute a breach of this Agreement unless such failure persists despite the provision of reasonable notice and an opportunity for the Employee to improve.

3. Compensation: The Employer shall pay the Employee a base salary as determined by the Employer in its sole discretion, subject to any applicable laws and regulations. It is understood that the Employer is under no obligation to provide any additional compensation or benefits unless expressly agreed upon in writing by both parties.

4. Termination: This Agreement may be terminated at any time by either party with or without cause upon providing a written notice of termination, with such notice period to be determined in the sole discretion of the terminating party. Upon termination, the Employee shall receive any accrued but unpaid salary and benefits up to the date of termination.

5. Confidentiality: The Employee acknowledges that in the course of his employment he may have access to confidential information relating to the Employer's business affairs, trade secrets, and proprietary information. The Employee agrees to keep such information confidential and not to disclose it to any third party without the prior written consent of the Employer. However, this obligation shall not extend to situations where the disclosure is required by law or court order.

6. Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware. Any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be resolved through binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association.

7. Entire Agreement: This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding and agreement between the parties regarding the employment of the Employee by the Employer, and supersedes any prior oral or written agreements between the parties concerning this subject matter. Any modifications to this Agreement must be in writing and signed by both parties.

8. Severability: In the event that any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable for any reason, such provision shall be reformed to reflect the intention of the parties to the maximum extent permissible under applicable law, and the remainder of this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect.

9. Waiver: The waiver by either party of a breach of any provision of this Agreement shall not operate or be construed as a waiver of any other or subsequent breach by such party.

10. Counterparts: This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original and all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.

In witness whereof, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the date first above written.

HYDRASPIN USA, INC.,

   Its: Name, Title, Signature

Employee: ________________________
   By: ________________________
   Its: Name, Title, Signature
